website_summaries.verdict: The Linksys Dual-Band Wireless-N Gigabit Router WRT320N forces you to pick either the 2.4GHz or the 5GHz band for your wireless network. Given that, it's not an ideal choice for an environment with both types of wireless clients. The router offers good wireless performance and features a high-speed wired network that caps at 1,000Mbps.
cons: Only works in either the 2.4GHz band or the 5GHz band at once

customer_reviews.title: Solid and affordable wireless router for slower Comcast internets
customer_reviews.text: I like to relive 2010 with 2.4ghz wireless internet from this Linksys router. It supports 5ghz too (one band at a time) but why go fast into the future when I can live in the past! 2010 was great. I was in a fraternity, met my now wife, and partied like it was 1999. This router has maxed out at about 150mbps speeds at the source (with cat6 and gigabit cables) but that’s ok because I only pay for 200mb internet with xfinity. Either way I may have kids and be old now but this router helps me relive my glory days!
customer_reviews.author: m00mAN

customer_reviews.title: Still using this for over 3 years
customer_reviews.text: This router is amazing, I'm a network guru and I've been using this router for years. I purchased this 3 years ago and it provides all the standard capabilities you'd find in most routers. This router works with the custom DD-WRT firmware which can turn this baby into a enterprise-grade router. I rarely find the need to reboot the router and so far have not run into any issues. I do tons of data transfer over gigabit and found no throttle or overheating of any sort. The wireless signal is pretty good and seem to work well even with lots of neighbors in the area also running Wi-Fi networks.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin S

customer_reviews.title: Quality Router
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing negative to say about this router. Easy to setup (if you know what your doing) great wireless coverage, great connection speeds with wireless N and gig ports, it's pretty. The only thing that might cause some confusion for buyers is that it does not support simultaneous Dual Bands, you can run in 2.4ghz or 5ghz spectrum, but not at the same time, but who cares. This router is great, I would recommend this product to anyone looking to replace or even upgrade your existing router. Out of the box, it is ready to go, and if you're an experienced user, the setup is just as easy as it's always been with Linksys-Cisco products!
customer_reviews.author: King Monty

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about two weeks now. Never once had any problems whatsoever. Set-up was easy, I didn't bother to use the included CD, just logged into my router and saved my desired settings. I purchased this as it was supposed to be better for Netflix streaming, and also as I wanted to upgrade from the old G standard. Since setting it up, Netflix has streamed flawlessly (unlike my old router which constantly reset halfway through a movie), the speed via the Gigabit ports is definitely better, and the wireless speed and range is considerably better than my old Belkin Pre-N router. Solid router, I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy set up
customer_reviews.text: This router replaced my ancient Linksys B router. I bought this one for better performance for internet TV streaming and it's working well except in my bedroom which was about 25 feet from the router. I was getting loss of internet signal quite often in the bedroom so I had to move the router to a closer position. So its claims of an ultra wide range don't seem to be valid at least in my house. It was very easy to set up and I did like having the Network Magic pro program the first week to get all the network set up/
customer_reviews.author: Susanne

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Bought the WRT320N for my parents who just recently got a laptop. I configured it prior to shipping it to them. I have setup many of these, so setup is easy for me. Throw the stupid disk away and use the web UI for configuration. Had it functioning as desired in 15 minutes. Shipped it to my parents. All they had to do is connect the cables, plug it in and turn it on. I setup the security so they had to enter the pass phrase on their laptop to associate with the router. No problems so far. Seems to work great.
customer_reviews.author: Muzzy

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product, worst support!
customer_reviews.text: I received this router with a lot of hope, however the router never worked, it seems it had a corrupted firmware, there was no way to fix this, however the process to return it was worst, after a lot of simply dum questions from Cisco's rep, I found out that it would cost me almost the same to return it than to buy a new one. True customer service should give you the option of simply ask for a new unit without all of the questions, if I want to change a just opened unit I should be able to no questions asked. Thumbs down for Cisco.
customer_reviews.author: R. Izquierdo

customer_reviews.title: easy to setup but erratic performance
customer_reviews.text: pluses: -easy enough to set up -linksys' support was actually pretty easy to reach and responsive--had someone online to chat at all times and followed up with phone calls and emails to see if the problem was resolved. minuses: -linksys easylink advisor program was incredibly slow to connect and a hassle -couldn't connect on the 5ghz channel w/ my card -connection kept dropping or slowing to a crawl after a week or two. was pretty disruptive to trying to either download or connect to work. replaced it with the apple airport extreme and the connection is stable and fast, and the peak download speeds increased
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I was really surprised. The range and speed is incredible. I can have my office closed, go in the bedroom closet 35 feet away, shut the door and still get a great signal. Just hope it does not buzz like my last Linksys did but so far so good. I have three computers, an iPhone, iPod, and a new Samsung TV, and DirecTV box all on the network playing nicely. I'm using Cisco Network Magic Pro and it's a real helper too if you're not into spending more than 10 min on a home network.
customer_reviews.author: A.Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Works, piece of cake to set up, decent range
customer_reviews.text: I had this thing on a different subnet, functioning, in about 10 minutes, without the use of the included software. Documentation is a bit dumbed down - there should be some info for someone who's set such stuff up before that is easy to find, but it's on the CD in a PDF file. Lights are well thought out. Performance and range are decent. Having the 4 Gb ports is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Cisco had brought Linksys a long way with configuration options. This router has been solid for me with great range. The only glitch so far is that my Tivo occasionally loses its IP address and needs its network settings refreshed in order to reconnect since introducing the WRT320N router to my network, but if that remains a problem I can assign a static IP. Overall a great router that I'd recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AnyAisles

customer_reviews.title: Cisco-Linksys WRT32-N Dual-Bank Wireless-N Gigabit Router
customer_reviews.text: I've had this router for a couple of years now and it has never failed me. I set the security on it immediately after coordinating it with my second computer and have never had any trouble with the router or a hacker. The secondary computer never fails to connect to the internet and works well.
customer_reviews.author: K.M. Kautz

customer_reviews.title: Cisco-Linksys WRT320N Dual-Band Wireless-N Gigabit Router
customer_reviews.text: This really was not the router than I expected because I was confused, but works excellent coverage of a 2 story home is perfect, it is very easy to configure, Abansa user is very simple and has more fuiciones than previous models, to home user is very simple to configure.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Venegas Lam

customer_reviews.title: Once you go "N", you don't go back
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace Wireless G in a multi family housing building. The 2.4 Ghz band is hopelessly crowded. The 5 Ghz wireless N did everything I needed in terms of data rate and signal range. Linksys routers, under XP or Vista, should be configured manually. The installation CD can get confused, and not hook you up.
customer_reviews.author: Donald K. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Perfect...not a single complaint
customer_reviews.text: Super easy set up. All 3 PC's connected flawless. The Bluray player is crazy fast streaming HD video, and the Wii has shown an increase in speed also. CRITICAL NOTE: Use CAT6 cable with this unit to realize its FULL potential. CAT5e is very good too, but using old CAT5 will choke you.
customer_reviews.author: Ringo

customer_reviews.title: Cisco Wireless router
customer_reviews.text: I have used many wireless routers before including those from D-Link, Belkin. The performance of the Cisco Linksys Dual-Brand Wireless N Gigabit Route is better than those I had in the past. I am especially happy with their Network Magic program which monitor the network and guard the system against intruders.
customer_reviews.author: Made Birdie!

customer_reviews.title: best in price and performance
customer_reviews.text: I had to immediately replace my 4 plus year old link sys wireless router and was about to spend a lot on the newest version. after reading online recommendations I chose this model and could not be more pleased. ease of setup has really improved since last purchase. in an hour I had two laptops, an iPad and my Roku box running to perfection.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bass

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to replace my WRT54G2. Needed a Wireless N enviorment, Great coverage (more signal bars than my previous model). I even bought a wireless range extender that ended up not using at all. Refurb price was more than adequate and unit works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Istvan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and set up
customer_reviews.text: This router was easy to set up even though I had to use some custom features because my high speed Internet coms in wirelss and uses PPPoE. The router recognized the differences and advised me what to do. So far it has performed with no problems. I do believe that it is faster than the last outer that I had. I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Electron Cleanslate

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router because I thought the old one was giving me gaming issues. It turned out to be my internet service provider and not the router, but this one has gigabit connections and I upgraded from G to N for a decent price. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: W. Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: Dual band, but not *simultaneous* dual band
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device hoping to support both my G devices (Tivo, iPhone) and my N devices (computers). I assumed this router could do G on the 2.4Ghz frequency and N on the 5Ghz frequency, but it can only use one band at a time. So I'm without the promise of higher speeds on the 5GHz frequency. I'm considering returning this for the WRT400N. Otherwise, the router is performing as hoped. It was quick to set up, and has been solid in the fews days I've had it running, including some heavy torrent downloading.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin T. Medina-orton

customer_reviews.title: Great Wireless Router
customer_reviews.text: Great wireless dual-band router. Get very good download speeds via the Internnet and Windows7 Home Network, my laptop is located 70' away and through two walls, still gets a signal quality up to 130mpbs..
customer_reviews.author: Relaxng

customer_reviews.title: Two years later, still good
customer_reviews.text: After two years of owning still works. I run a Playstation 3 in the next room over on the wireless network and works, not always perfect but good most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product as I had several Giga-bit nodes and a 802.11N Notebook so I nneded the increase speed. I must admit the setup wasn't as easy as the WRT110 that I just replaced but once I had re-program all my wireless devices it worked great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ian E. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: I bought the router as a refurb, and it's held up so far. It came in its own box and looked new. The firmware is old though. If there's a newer version, I'd like to update. Otherwise, it's worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: bobw

customer_reviews.title: NOT a simultaneous dual band router
customer_reviews.text: It does the job. But it's not a simultaneous dual band. In other words you can only choose to run either a 2.4Ghz Band or a 5Ghz band not both. docked some stars. But it runs real smooth. Imo better than the Linksys smart router i had.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Trout

customer_reviews.title: Look Elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: I've worked in IT for 15 years. If it takes me more than an hour to set anything up, it's a piece of crap. This unfortunately falls into that category. I have a Windows 7 machine and I attempted the set-up process 6 times to no avail. The router, with all lights functioning, was unable to detect my internet while my router from 2003 still functioned properly. I'm sending this back in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Chris P

customer_reviews.title: We are in the country and don't get good reception without it
customer_reviews.text: Works well for us . We are in the country and don't get good reception without it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Works ok
customer_reviews.text: User GUI is a bit primative and does not offer many configuration options as other models. Used it a couple oy but have upgraded to a netgear one.
customer_reviews.author: mrjake

customer_reviews.title: plug and play winner
customer_reviews.text: This dual band n router is that best buy for your money. I have two gaming systems and 3 pc s, not to mention a ipod and ipad and a wireless printer. This router has really made a speed and consistent connection improvement over my prior router.
customer_reviews.author: sakapala

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: It only lasted about two years and finally stopped connecting. The entire time it has to get reset. First once a month, then once every couple weeks, then every day, then finally died....
customer_reviews.author: Bigfoot

customer_reviews.title: Great Home Router..
customer_reviews.text: Great Item to use if you're looking to network your home. Menu and interface makes it easy for everyone to have their system up and running in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Toledo

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and broken!
customer_reviews.text: The product worked well for about a week but then we lost the wireless N capability on it. I didn't realize how cheap Cisco had become until doing further research.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother. this thing is pretty lame now-a-days. Get something from Netgear, Linksys has lost it since the buyout by Cisco.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron’s Final Word

customer_reviews.title: worked
customer_reviews.text: The product showed up on time The product packaging was adequate The product was easy to install The product worked
customer_reviews.author: Vic Graninger

customer_reviews.title: Seller great. Product poor. Overheat
customer_reviews.text: Everything from this seller was awesome. My problem is that this unit as well as others like it that I bought overheat too much for my liking. Switched to a different model
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Worked a few months, but every time power goes out it dies and has to be re-initialized. Finally quit working 1 year and a day after purchase!!! No warranty
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Price friendly Effective router
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to upgrade the "cheap" give away that I received when I purchased my laptop. I have had absolutely no problems with this unit, from setup to day-today use it has been wonderful. Additionally, it was price was very friendly ( I don't think I paid $100 for it).
customer_reviews.author: Quintain Olden

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Router was exactly as described including the ease of setup. Plugged it in, selected a few settings, connected my desktop PC and Photosmart printer, and everything worked perfectly. Later I added a wireless connection for my Laptop with no problem. Shipping was exceptionally fast, I got it in three days which was less than the estimated delivery.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gould

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and EASY
customer_reviews.text: Ready to go out of the box on notebook with Windows XP Pro. On second notebook with Vista, a telephone call to tech support quickly got that unit online. Not the fault of the modem but Microsoft Vista as usual. If tech support wasn't as good as it is, then the documentation would need to be improved. Wireless range excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Atys Papageorge

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I usually do not buy refurb products, however this one turned out to be an excellent buy. Works as good as new and at a better price.
customer_reviews.author: Jim W. Riess

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to the whole wireless thing and I was dreading setting up the router. But it was so much easier than I had expected. Good product. I would recommend it to everyone
customer_reviews.author: AngelR

customer_reviews.title: A+ with DD-WRT
customer_reviews.text: Flash this puppy with DD-WRT (third party software, Google it) and you have one truly awesome router. The wireless radio in these has consistently been the best radio of any model I've ever used.
customer_reviews.author: MoonShadow

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: easy to set up and works great. I have full wifi connection everywhere in my home and out on the porch. I get 3-4 bars out in the backyard. Great router for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Red Sox fan

customer_reviews.title: Super Fast Problem Free Router - Don't forget the modem
customer_reviews.text: We love this router. No Problems. Works terrific. You do have to have a separate modem. Easy to set up. We needed a faster connection in order to stream video both on the web & with Netflix through our Wii. This worked great! We've been using it for 2 months now & have no problems. Just be aware that even with a good router, you have to have the internet connection speed to go with it or it won't be any faster.
customer_reviews.author: busymom

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Our wireless range is large and reaches outside. Now I can mow the grass and facebook at the same time!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Long

customer_reviews.title: Nice router
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and works very well. Have had no issues in the two weeks have been using. It's nice to have a wireless blu-ray as well, now I can watch BBC news anytime I want.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Lennington

customer_reviews.title: very nice product works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to review works perfectly And very easy to install. Range is great covers the whole 4000 sq foot home.
customer_reviews.author: George W. Edington

customer_reviews.title: Only performs the basics
customer_reviews.text: I set this guy up as I would any other wireless router: WPA2, non-transmitting name, block ActiveX, server in DMZ. It could not handle this. I have since removed all restrictions and now only have WPA2 enabled. I have also noticed that the initial handshaking for connecting over the wireless takes a lot longer than it does on other wireless routers (have only compared with Netgear routers). I am currently looking for a replacement for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris113

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Router
customer_reviews.text: Looks great. Workes as described Easy Setup. Replaced after a few years. Easy installation. Would purchase again. No outages while working.
customer_reviews.author: jenni raczak

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product works great. Haven't had any problems with it. Easy to follow installation directions!!
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: CIsco-Linksys WRT320N Dual-Band Wireless-N Bogabit Router
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to hook-up. And my lap top was fine. But my desk computer started crashing. So we disconnected the Router and my desk computer was OK. We re-connected the Router a little differently and now everything is fine. Especially when we have visitors. It has a strong signal.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia King-Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Gigabit router!!
customer_reviews.text: This router is really amazing; super fast and reasonably priced!! Support to set up the router was also outstanding. I would recommend this as a great primary or secondary router for fast streaming of video or gaming!! Do it!!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Germain

customer_reviews.title: wrt320n works fine
customer_reviews.text: This seems to work just fine. I've never used one before, hooked it up to a wireless usb hub to free up the laptop and it has been very convenient. WXP home OS easily set it up. Typically 54mps, downloads easily, it's actually pretty seamless.
customer_reviews.author: wendell O.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use router
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router to increase security on my PC that was attacked by spyware and viruses. It has been a couple of months now and I have not had any issues since I installed this router. (I did however, install Norton Internet Security at the same time.) The router was easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany C. Roy

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes signal is not too good though.
customer_reviews.text: Fairly solid router. Sometimes signal is not too good though.
customer_reviews.author: calandale

customer_reviews.title: Wroked Great Out of the Box
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup, worked great, tested with ipod touch by walking about 50-100 yards, still full signal and no lag.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice
customer_reviews.text: I'm using the 5Ghz mode with N lan on 2 laptops and my desktop is connected to the gigabit port, I must say that I love this router, I can let both laptops connected without problems for a long time, but on the 2,4Ghz when the phone rings sometimes the wireless is gone... I recommend to anyone that will use the 5Ghz network.
customer_reviews.author: Marcelo Gomes

customer_reviews.title: Would have been nice to keep if not for ISP
customer_reviews.text: Got this router, it was a very nice and easy set up. Recommend following each step exactly, very simple set-up, the easy-link program that comes with it was also very nice. The wired network was perfect between the Vista 64-bit and XP, and the tech support was very helpful. Unfortunetly my ISP provider didn't recognize the router and insisted that the only one I could use is their's, so I had to send it back, and was able to return with refund minus shipping cost without any trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: good router
customer_reviews.text: I got this here router and set it up. Works just like they said it did and was able to get the 1000mb network cable speed for a cheap price. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Brando

customer_reviews.title: best router i have ever had!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this router. It was very easy to set up. And, it hasn't given me any issues. Absolutely fantastic!!!!
customer_reviews.author: SSS

customer_reviews.title: Cisco-linksys WRT320N
customer_reviews.text: This one is no good! It has to be reset every time I want to go on the net!
customer_reviews.author: Tomstick

customer_reviews.title: Davit Kapanadze
customer_reviews.text: This product met my expectations. It has all the features I need. Connected three wireless N devices to it and all of them are connected and working flawlessly. Throughput is more than enough in either radio mode.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Failed Within One Hour
customer_reviews.text: Product failed within one hour of installation - it went "off" and would not come back on. Had to pay cost for shipment back to CA for replacement. Went to Walmart for a fill-in replacement of a different brand. Will probably continue using it after Cisco product replacement arrives. Will avoid Cisco in future.
customer_reviews.author: phd

customer_reviews.title: For the Novice Installer
customer_reviews.text: It just doesn't get any easier than this. Installation is a breeze and it only takes a few minutes to do it. If you can get yourself out of bed you're more than capable of installing this product. I've had this for a few weeks now and it functions flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: R. K. Hawes

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: works great! a little pricey, couple a glitches in the beginning, but works good for wifi and streaming video all over the house.
customer_reviews.author: tkj1

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: This was my first wireless router. Very easy to set up and sue. No problems at all. Good signal within my house.
customer_reviews.author: jimp

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Very easy to setup. Good wireless signal strength and not a lot of interference on the channels. Strongly recommend this router
customer_reviews.author: M. Rassiwala

customer_reviews.title: Out of the Box and On-Line
customer_reviews.text: Ordered and received promptly. Opened the box, followed the instructions and in no time I was on-line with fast connectivity. I jus love it.
customer_reviews.author: Marv A.

customer_reviews.title: Cool
customer_reviews.text: I bought tis router cause I thought it had wider range, but it's ok for me. Well, I have close to a week using it, I think I should use it for more time to have a valid opinion
customer_reviews.author: Agustin

customer_reviews.title: Good So Far
customer_reviews.text: I have had this wireless router for six weeks. It was simple to install and I have not had to reboot it since the initial install. Working great so far.
customer_reviews.author: jma

customer_reviews.title: Great router compared to conpetition.
customer_reviews.text: This router runs great. The only negative thing I have found is the device webpage for it is somewhat slow compared to other routers I have had. Otherwise it is a great router and is great price for the features.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Getting better all the time.
customer_reviews.text: Getting Linksys routers set-up has come a long way. All was very straightforward and has been working reliably. Had it set-up in a short amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: OK product but
customer_reviews.text: OK product but wireless distance is about 15 feet. You can't use A, B, G and N network. In the setting an (A and G) or (G and N) have to be selected. For security protection yearly charges $40.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Zik

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the latest routers from Linksys. I have at&t high speed internet service so setup was somewhat of a challenge. Once I got the router setup, I've had no problems. It works great and my Wireless-N speed is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Horace Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because my son recommended it to me (he is a software engineer). I found it is exactly what I wanted. and so far, it works fine, without any kind of problems.
customer_reviews.author: Raul Ruiz Camauer

customer_reviews.title: Wireless range is not as good as expected. So so range.
customer_reviews.text: Wireless range is not as good as expected. So so range. Everything else is fine.
customer_reviews.author: George-USA

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with router
customer_reviews.text: I got this router about a month ago and have been very pleased with it. It was very easy to install into my system and has worked well with no glitches so far. It has good range --my laptop will pick it up out to about 80 - 90 feet, and the security features were also easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Wired on all

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: This router works great. I have a home network and the range is great for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Gonzalo Techera

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to configure, I can see all devices on my network....still prefer the browser interface better for editing the configuration.
customer_reviews.author: Donna M. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: Overall this router is great! Easy to set up with excellent wireless range! Very reasonable price too!
customer_reviews.author: Bob in San Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't have the range ot a wrt160n
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many configurations with this router and still can't get the signal out of it that I get from my wrt160n. I'm hoping that someday the firmware will fix this problem.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hollowell

customer_reviews.title: Great software
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised. Arrived on time. Unexpected was the software that was sent with the router, with a 30 day free trial. I purchased the program the next day. We love the system-sharing software. Oh and the router too.
customer_reviews.author: DAB

customer_reviews.title: Solid Performer. Great Value.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Cisco router. Set-up from opening the box to using the net is literally 5 minutes. Even the most novice user can do this without any issue. This a good, reliable router for the price & you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: G. Tall

customer_reviews.title: Using with Comcast
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble connecting to a Comcast modem. However, I tried the instructions in: [...] and got it to work. Long live internet!
customer_reviews.author: arahant

customer_reviews.title: No noticeable improvement
customer_reviews.text: I had an old 802.11b wireless access point/router that I thought I would replace with the highest speed thingy I could get. Linksys still felt like a good brand and the new product works just fine. But I don't notice any speed improvement at all. The downsides are: doesn't work with my Xbox 360 like my old one... and I swear it has LESS range than my old one.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen P. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Problems updating firmware
customer_reviews.text: I bought my wrt320n router in April 2009 and I had many problems of loss of connection and slow. Every day was necessary restarting it. In August 2009 I updated the FIRMWARE following all the instructions and the router finally stopped working (power light blinking all time). The problem was not solved until today.
customer_reviews.author: A. Giannetti

customer_reviews.title: Great value Cisco Wireless Router
customer_reviews.text: Cisco makes the most reliable and esaiest to setup routers on the market today and this one is no exception. It is well worth the money. It was easy to setup and worked the first time.
customer_reviews.author: John J. Shea

customer_reviews.title: WIRE LESS ROUTER
customer_reviews.text: THE ROUTER IS WORKING V. GOOD AND I AM LOVING IT , BUT THE PROBLEM THAT WHEN I BOUGHT IT IT WAS WRITTEN THE CD ROM ISS INCLODED WHICH WAS NOT , AFTER THAT THEY SEND IT .EVEN THEY SAID THAT THEY WILL GIVE ME 10 $ BACK WHICH THEY DID NOT . BUT AT ALL THE PRODUCT IT PERFICT
customer_reviews.author: JERO

product_meta.title: Cisco-Linksys WRT320N Dual-Band Wireless-N Gigabit Router
product_meta.description:
The sleek Dual-Band Wireless-N Gigabit Router works in two different radio bands, letting you choose the one with the least interference in your area. Either one delivers great Wireless-N performance for smooth streaming video, high frame-rate gaming, and fast data transfers all with great range and reduced dead spots. The 4 built-in Gigabit ports provide connections to your wired devices that are ten times as fast as standard Fast Ethernet ports.

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: High-performance dual-band wireless-N router for connecting wired and wireless devices
Wireless-N technology for blazing-fast performance, great range, and reduced dead spots
Four 10/100/1000 Gigabit Ethernet ports for connecting wired devices, such as computers, printers, and more
128-Bit wireless encryption and SPI firewall for air-tight security
Measures 7.95 x 1.34 x 6.3 inches and weighs 10.58 ounces;

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars170 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
